commentary: Rashid to Shanaka, OUT turns sharply, and deflected to short third man. No run remotely possible there, but this is excruciatingly tight as Shanaka is sent back, quite rightly, by Tharanga. Buttler whips off the bails and there is a solitary frame in this decision. And after a long deliberation, Bruce Oxenford says out! In all honesty, I'm not convinced the bail was entirely out of its groove, but it's a total judgement call when things get that tight. And the worst bit of judgement was the attempted run in the first place!
text: turns sharply, and deflected to short third man. No run remotely possible there, but this is excruciatingly tight as Shanaka is sent back, quite rightly, by Tharanga. Buttler whips off the bails and there is a solitary frame in this decision. And after a long deliberation, Bruce Oxenford says out! In all honesty, I'm not convinced the bail was entirely out of its groove, but it's a total judgement call when things get that tight. And the worst bit of judgement was the attempted run in the first place!

commentary: Jordan to Tharanga, 1 run crunched into the covers but limited to a single

commentary: Jordan to Maharoof, 1 run very full, very straight, and though the lbw appeal is turned down, the fact that a run is given persuades Morgan to review. Because he's convinced there was no bat involved ... but it seems there was just the thinnest slice of splinter of inside-edge ... not out

commentary: Jordan to Tharanga, 1 run thumped down the ground, another single
text: thumped down the ground, another single

commentary: Jordan to Maharoof, 1 run very full, drilled on the up to long-on
text: very full, drilled on the up to long-on

commentary: Jordan to Tharanga, 1 run crunched into the leg-side, but that's another fine over from Jordan. Full or short, he has varied his line and length impeccably
text: crunched into the leg-side, but that's another fine over from Jordan. Full or short, he has varied his line and length impeccably

commentary: Woakes to Tharanga, 2 runs clipped firmly to deep midwicket where Roy and Hales once again work in perfect harmony to slide and save the boundary
text: clipped firmly to deep midwicket where Roy and Hales once again work in perfect harmony to slide and save the boundary

commentary: Woakes to Tharanga, 1 leg bye on the pads, a bit of a let-off as the ball thuds behind square off the pad
text: on the pads, a bit of a let-off as the ball thuds behind square off the pad

commentary: Woakes to Maharoof, 1 run flogged up and over the leg-side, Root - still not moving completely freely - jogs round to gather
text: flogged up and over the leg-side, Root - still not moving completely freely - jogs round to gather

commentary: Woakes to Tharanga, 1 run low full toss, crunched behind square with an energetic fling of willow through the line
text: low full toss, crunched behind square with an energetic fling of willow through the line

commentary: Woakes to Maharoof, OUT short but not that short, pulled ambitiously through the leg-side, Root and Bairstow circle beneath it, Bairstow makes the call, guzzles the chance, and Sri Lanka's faltering charge falters once more
text: short but not that short, pulled ambitiously through the leg-side, Root and Bairstow circle beneath it, Bairstow makes the call, guzzles the chance, and Sri Lanka's faltering charge falters once more

commentary: Woakes to Tharanga, OUT bowled him! Line and length, nipping off the deck, trimming the bails on the top of middle stump and Thranga has a wipe across the line and connects with thin air!
text: bowled him! Line and length, nipping off the deck, trimming the bails on the top of middle stump and Thranga has a wipe across the line and connects with thin air!

commentary: Willey to Lakmal, 1 leg bye full length, nipping in, deflecting into the covers off the pad
text: full length, nipping in, deflecting into the covers off the pad

commentary: Willey to Pradeep, 1 run hoofed up and over the bowler's head, lots of sound and fury but the ball barely goes anywhere
text: hoofed up and over the bowler's head, lots of sound and fury but the ball barely goes anywhere

commentary: Willey to Lakmal, 1 run cracked out to the leg-side
text: cracked out to the leg-side

commentary: Willey to Pradeep, 1 run clobbered into the covers, a big wind-up but he clothed his shot
text: clobbered into the covers, a big wind-up but he clothed his shot

commentary: Willey to Lakmal, no run turns his stance around in an attempt to flick over fine leg, but no contact
text: turns his stance around in an attempt to flick over fine leg, but no contact

commentary: Willey to Lakmal, 2 runs yorker length slower ball, slapped without power into the deep. Jordan's shy is unusually poor and so Sri Lanka survive a last-ball run-out, but that does not feel like enough runs for a pitch like this
text: yorker length slower ball, slapped without power into the deep. Jordan's shy is unusually poor and so Sri Lanka survive a last-ball run-out, but that does not feel like enough runs for a pitch like this

commentary: Lakmal to Roy, no run starts on a shortish length over off stump, Roy cramped for room blocks down the track
text: starts on a shortish length over off stump, Roy cramped for room blocks down the track

commentary: Lakmal to Roy, 1 run short and a touch wide, drops back and frees the arms to chop one past backward point
text: short and a touch wide, drops back and frees the arms to chop one past backward point

commentary: Lakmal to Hales, OUT back of a length, Hales plays away from his body - and nicks to the keeper! Big, thick deflection, the ball skidding on, Hales trying to force off the back foot. From an unbeaten hundred to a golden duck in the space of two days! SL have the early breakthrough they needed
